headline: Did Southwest’s Shift to Assigned Seating and Premium Cabins Just Recast Its (LUV) Investment Narrative?
summary: Southwest Airlines has begun a major overhaul of its business model, rolling out assigned seating, premium cabins, network expansion, and leadership changes ahead of its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results webcast scheduled for January 29, 2026. This shift away from the carrier’s long-standing open-seating approach marks a significant repositioning aimed at competing more directly with full-service airlines while maintaining core brand elements like two free checked bags. Next, we’ll...

headline: Big Tech earnings, Fed meeting feature as markets end January with busiest week of Q1: What to watch
summary: As geopolitical tensions simmer in the background, Big Tech earnings and the January Fed meeting take center stage this week.

headline: Assessing Southwest Airlines (LUV) Valuation After Recent Choppy Share Price Performance
summary: Why Southwest Airlines Stock Is Back On Radar Southwest Airlines (LUV) has caught investor attention after recent trading, with shares around $41.95 and a mix of short term pullbacks and longer term gains that may prompt a closer look. See our latest analysis for Southwest Airlines. Recent trading has been choppy, with a 1 day share price return of 1.15% decline and a 7 day share price return of 2.71% decline, yet the 90 day share price return of 30.08% and 1 year total shareholder return of...
